conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle starting at point A with zero initial velocity and exiting at point C with speed v0, angle between AC and AB is 60 degrees, only subjected to electric force.
Electric force acting on the particle is F = qE, causing acceleration in the direction of the electric field.
Work-energy theorem: Work done by electric force equals change in kinetic energy, initial kinetic energy is zero, final kinetic energy at C is K_C = 1/2 m v_0^2.
Work done by electric force is W = qE * x_{AC}, using work-energy theorem: qE * x_{AC} = 1/2 m v_0^2.
Displacement x_{AC} along the direction of the electric field determined using angle theta = 60 degrees, electric field directed vertically downward.
Length of AC calculated using law of cosines: AC = R sqrt(3/2).
Vertical displacement x_{AC} is projection of AC onto direction of electric field: x_{AC} = R * 3/(2 sqrt(2)).
Substitute x_{AC} into work-energy equation: E = (m v_0^2)/(q * R * 3/sqrt(2)).
